website_summaries.verdict: For a good quality chair that can adjust to any size for your child's height and leg length, these Tripp Trapp chairs really deliver.
pros: You can use this chair much longer than the others
It fully adjusts to any needed height
Older children do not mind using them
A baby set is available to hook to the seat
The adjustable foot rest makes it comfortable for sitting
cons: It is pricier than most boosters, but an investment that will last through childhood and can be passed from child to child

customer_reviews.title: good looking, long lasting
customer_reviews.text: My 3-year-old son loves his red Tripp Trapp chair. Its easy to climb on and he's proud that he has his own adult chair. It was easy to assemble and I've adjusted it a couple of times without much difficulty. The wood and painted surface are of excellent quality. Its very very easy to wipe clean - much easier than our wooden dining chairs and our other toddler's plastic booster. My 1-year-old is always trying to climb onto the chair, so we'll probably get one for her too.
customer_reviews.author: Big Ears

customer_reviews.title: red stokke tripp trapp chair!
customer_reviews.text: Finally i bought it for my son (16 months old) and it works just fine. This chair looks great in my dining room, the design is really nice for my child and also for my house decoration (: ...Its nice and my son will use it for many years i hope. It includes a new plastic part to have more security (so the child wont fall back) My son sits very comfortable in it. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ma J. Vargas Peña

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: We've only had ours for 2 months, so I can't comment on durability. But with the harness, cushion, and tabletop it works well as a high chair. The reason for buying this is for its adaptability. From high chair to adult chair and everything in between. Given the solid construction I can see this lasting for years. The red is an appealing color.
customer_reviews.author: Greyman

customer_reviews.title: I like it as much as my toddler!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great high-chair. I like the design, it's sturdy, doesn't damage my cork floor when you slide it around and my toddler loves it. I've had this since my daughter was around 7 months old and she's now 21 months. I like the fact that this chair will grow with my daughter for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: J. Yu

customer_reviews.title: STURDY! This chair is SOLID
customer_reviews.text: STURDY! This chair is SOLID. My babies were huge and my toddlers were even bigger. These chairs grew with the kids. It was nice to get rid of the high chairs. Worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Hand me downs
customer_reviews.text: All of our grandkids have these chairs and we are still using ones purchased for our nieces over 40 years ago. Classic design and they really hold up
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered one more for our 2nd child
customer_reviews.text: If you want to buy a seat that you can fully adjust to give your child the best support while sitting, get the Tripp Trapp. Not many seats have a sturdy leg rest -- great for toddlers, and no blockage to the dining table -- great for eating with us at the table. It's pricey but it'll last for a very long time. We sometimes even use it as a ladder to get stuff from higher shelves. It's that sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: LiveLifeSexy

customer_reviews.title: Great Highchair
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction and beautiful! We love this highchair and so do our kids. We have one in green also but purchased this for our second child because they both love it so much they were fighting over who got to sit in it! Cleans well.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: It's been great so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my friend raved about it. It's been great so far, but we've only had it for a few months so far. I bought a Tarpy high chair splat mat to go under it, because our dining room is carpeted. The two work great together. I also am borrowing the infant chair insert and that works great for us.
customer_reviews.author: PhilaMila

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love that we chose the red. It's the perfect pop of color.
customer_reviews.author: Memoir lover

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I love the trip trap. We have one for our son (now 5) and got an additional one for our little daughter. It is very sturdy and stable - which is important once the kid starts climbing on it alone. It has been great and used a lot! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: sbz

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! LOVE IT!! Even 4.5 years later!
customer_reviews.text: As a Scandinavian, this was the chair my generation grew up on. We have two kids and they're still using it at 4.5 years of age. It grows with the child, and enables proper ergonomics throughout. With the Stokke chair they enjoy a meal and sit still to eat. I think it just calms them down to be at the right height. There's no wiggly discomfort that we see at a lot of friends' houses where the kids graduate to a grown up chair far too early. Peace of mind to enjoy the food then you don't have your plate at eye level. Well made, so well thought out!
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My daughter grew up in one -- this one a baby present for her new baby.
customer_reviews.author: Sailordad

customer_reviews.title: Chair to grow with
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my granddaughter . Her 3 year old brother still uses his that his parents bought for him. This was actually was a little less than his that was bought elsewhere .Also happy to find one this color.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: not being used
customer_reviews.text: The Tripp Trap is solid. Maybe too solid. My kids cannot get up on their own with out bang themselves. I have bumped into this chair or stubbed my toe. Very painful. Not super comfy. I did not want to buy the expensive pad. I give this an okay rating.
customer_reviews.author: knickD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is for our autistic daughter and it is perfect for her.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Walters

customer_reviews.title: This is the "must have" high chair
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Stokke Tripp Trapp that I have purchased. The first is still in use by my now four year old daughter. This one was for my one year old son. It really is the "must have" high chair. Both of my children sit comfortably and eat dinner at our dining room table every night. I bought the plastic baby guard for this chair because our older seat only has a waist belt, but this newer seat has an over the shoulder harness, so I don't think we even needed the guard. This seat is worth the money...your little ones will be sitting in it for many, many years.
customer_reviews.author: BusyBurbankBee

customer_reviews.title: Best for older toddlers / kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking and space efficient chair, but it's been incredibly messy since our baby started to eat finger foods. It's too bad it doesn't have a tray attachment for infants to early toddlers. As first time parents we didn't realize how convenient a tray would be -- much easier than repairing our wood table from baby banging and cleaning up a huge mess from the floor. We bought a second high chair with a tray and put our Stokke chair away for a while. We're hoping it will become useful later as our baby grows.
customer_reviews.author: P. Klemens

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chair!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair for my mom (who keeps my daughter a ton!). It looks GREAT - was easy to put together - and my 15 month old LOVES to crawl up and down. She thinks she is really cool. I will definitely buy one for myself soon.
customer_reviews.author: L. Combs

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chair for children. This is the second one my family has purchased. We have two young children and they both have one. The chair is very comfortable, easy to clean. It also can be adjusted for all ages to make it easy to reach the table. Adults can sit in the chair also. The only complaint is the price is high.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is WAY better than a high chair. It pushes right up to the table. We have our one and two year olds in these chairs. The kids can climb in and buckle themselves!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: The chair looks great, is incredibly functional and will grow with your little one for years to come! You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Reva Parness

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CHAIR
customer_reviews.text: MY LITTLE 2YR OLD GRAND DAUGHTER THINKS THIS CHAIR IS GREAT, SHE HAS A BIG GIRL CHAIR NOW.
customer_reviews.author: M. W. Bradley

product_meta.title: Stokke Tripp Trapp Chair, Red
feature_bullets: Brings your baby to the dining table and closer to the family
Baby set and cushion accessories provide comfort for your baby
Highly adjustable seat and footplate positions
Available in a variety of colors for your baby boy or girl
Classic Scandinavian design by Peter Opsvik

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars46 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
